interviewer_dialogue: Hi.  This is Interviewer, the landlady.

patient_dialogue: Hi, Interviewer.  This is Patient in 3B.  I’m calling because-- I called a couple days ago.  There was a slow uh.. water leak in the ceiling, and uh.. I’m just following up with you tryin’ to find out when you might be able to come fix it.
interviewer_dialogue: Uhm.. I’m sorry I haven’t had enough time to get over to fix it, but I’ve been very busy.

patient_dialogue: I understand.  Uhm.. when do you think you’ll be able to get back over here?
interviewer_dialogue: I have a lot of other tenants with problems that are ahead of yours.

patient_dialogue: Okay.  Are they wor-- the leak has gotten so much worse.  Can you please get here as soon as possible?
interviewer_dialogue: It didn’t sound that bad the last time you called.

patient_dialogue: It wasn’t, but now i- it’s a lot worse than it was.  Uhm.. it’s ruining the sheetrock.  Uhm.. the sheetrock’s falling in from the ceiling and I’m really worried that it’s gonna fall on me.
interviewer_dialogue: It might take me about a week, maybe even two weeks, before I’ll have time to fix it.

patient_dialogue: Oh, my.  Okay.  If there’s any water damage between then and now, I do expect you will cover that?
interviewer_dialogue: I do all the repairs myself for the whole building.
Mm. <laughs> Uhm.. so what have you done about the problem so far?

patient_dialogue: Uhm.. I’ve put buckets out to catch the water.  I’ve put towels on the floor.  Uhm.. that’s really all I could do.
interviewer_dialogue: I have a list and you’re on the list, but there are problems that are more serious.

patient_dialogue: Okay.  Well, it’s really important that you get here as soon as possible so we don’t have any mo-- any further damage.
interviewer_dialogue: Well, I don’t know what I can do about your problem right now.

patient_dialogue: <laughs> Uh.. I would’ve-- uh.. tell you the truth, I would’ve hung up. <laughs> I just woulda hung up.
interviewer_dialogue: Hm.  Mm... I’m sorry I haven’t had enough time to get over to fix it, but I’m very busy.

patient_dialogue: Okay.  How about you buy the parts and I’ll fix it myself?
interviewer_dialogue: No, you don’t need to do that.  I’m aware of the problem and I’ll be over as soon as I can.
